label: Flood
desc: a type of hydrological natural disaster that occurs when an overflow of water submerges land that is usually dry

label: Mass movement
desc: a general term refers to hydrological events that cause adverse up-and-down movements of slope-forming materials such as landslides or avalanches.

label: Volcanic eruption
desc: a type of geological natural disaster which molten rock, ash, gas, and other materials are expelled from an active volcanic body (volcanos)

label: Earthquake
desc: is a type of geological natural disaster where sudden shakings of the ground occured due to the breaking and shifting of rock beneath the Earthâ€™s surface.

label: Wildfire
desc: are unplanned fire that burns in a natural area such as a forest, grassland, or prairie. They are considered meteorological natural disasters

label: Storm
desc: a type of meteorological natural disasters caused by atmospheric disturbance characterized by strong winds and usually accompanied by rain
